messages.content:
You are a professional academic reference prediction expert. Your task is to predict the most likely references for a given academic paper based on its title, abstract, and retrieved relevant papers.

RETRIEVER INTERFACE:
- Input: paper title + abstract
- Output: {top_r} retrieved papers with title and abstract
- Format: List of dictionaries with 'title' and 'abstract' fields

REQUIREMENTS:
1. Analyze the paper's title and abstract to understand its research area and focus
2. Consider the retrieved papers as potential references (when available)
3. Generate a list of predicted reference titles that would be most relevant and likely to be cited
4. Provide reasoning for each prediction to prevent hallucination
5. Output format: JSON object with "titles" array and "reasoning" string
6. Generate exactly 46 most relevant reference titles (this should be at least 40 to cover all evaluation metrics)
7. Ensure titles are realistic and appropriate for the research area
8. Consider citation patterns in the field
9. CRITICAL: Each title must be unique - never repeat the same title multiple times

EXAMPLE:
Input:
Title: "Question Type Classification Methods Comparison"
Abstract: "The paper presents a comparative study of state-of-the-art approaches for question classification task: Logistic Regression, Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN), Long Short-Term Memory Network (LSTM) and Quasi-Recurrent Neural Networks (QRNN). All models use pre-trained GLoVe word embeddings and trained on human-labeled data. The best accuracy is achieved using CNN model with five convolutional layers and various kernel sizes stacked in parallel, followed by one fully connected layer. The model reached 90.7% accuracy on TREC 10 test set."

Retrieved papers ({top_r}):
1. Title: Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification
   Abstract: We report on a series of experiments with convolutional neural networks trained on top of pre-trained word vectors for sentence-level classification tasks.

2. Title: Glove: Global vectors for word representation
   Abstract: We present a new global log-bilinear regression model that combines the advantages of the two major model families in the literature.

Output:
{
  "titles": [
    "Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification",
    "Glove: Global vectors for word representation",
    "Quasi-Recurrent Neural Networks",
    "A Comparative Study of Neural Network Models for Sentence Classification",
    "Deep lstm based feature mapping for query classification"
  ],
  "reasoning": "Based on the paper's focus on question classification using neural networks, I predict these references because: 1) CNN paper is directly relevant to the convolutional approach used; 2) GloVe embeddings are mentioned as pre-trained features; 3) QRNN is one of the compared methods; 4) Comparative study papers are common in this field; 5) LSTM-based query classification is closely related to question classification. Additional references cover related neural network architectures, NLP applications, deep learning methodologies, optimization techniques, and advanced neural network methods that would be relevant for this research area."
}

Return JSON object only.

Paper Title: Age of Information Analysis for Multi-Priority Queue and NOMA Enabled C-V2X in IoV This work was supported in part by the National Natural Science Foundation of China under Grant No. 61701197, in part by the National Key Research and Development Program of China under Grant No.2021YFA1000500(4), in part by the 111 Project under Grant No. B12018.

Paper Abstract: Abstract As development Internet-of-Vehicles (IoV) technology and demand for Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS) increase, there is a growing need for real-time data and communication by vehicle users. Traditional request-based methods face challenges such as latency and bandwidth limitations. Mode 4 in Connected Vehicle-to-Everything (C-V2X) addresses latency and overhead issues through autonomous resource selection. However, Semi-Persistent Scheduling (SPS) based on distributed sensing may lead to increased collision. Non-Orthogonal Multiple Access (NOMA) can alleviate the problem of reduced packet reception probability due to collisions. Moreover, the concept of Age of Information (AoI) is introduced as a comprehensive metric reflecting reliability and latency performance, analyzing the impact of NOMA on C-V2X communication system. AoI indicates the time a message spends in both local waiting and transmission processes. In C-V2X, waiting process can be extended to queuing process, influenced by packet generation rate and Resource Reservation Interval (RRI). The transmission process is mainly affected by transmission delay and success rate. In C-V2X, a smaller selection window (SW) limits the number of available resources for vehicles, resulting in higher collision rates with increased number of vehicles. SW is generally equal to RRI, which not only affects AoI in queuing process but also AoI in the transmission process. Therefore, this paper proposes an AoI estimation method based on multi-priority data type queues and considers the influence of NOMA on the AoI generated in both processes in C-V2X system under different RRI conditions. This work aims to gain a better performance of C-V2X system comparing with some known algorithms..

{retrieved_text}

Generate exactly 46 most likely reference titles for this paper. Focus on papers that are directly related to the research topic, provide foundational background, present similar methodologies, or address related problems.

CRITICAL: Each title must appear exactly once. Do not repeat any title.

IMPORTANT: You must respond with ONLY valid JSON in this exact format:
{
    "titles": [
        "Reference Title 1",
        "Reference Title 2",
        "Reference Title 3",
        "Reference Title 4",
        "Reference Title 46"
    ],
    "reasoning": "Explain why you chose these specific references based on the paper's title, abstract, and retrieved papers. This helps prevent hallucination and ensures relevance."
}

Do not include any text before or after the JSON. Do not include authors, venues, or years - only the paper titles. The reasoning field is required to explain your prediction logic.

{
    "titles": [
        "Study on Refined Deployment of Wireless Mesh Sensor Network",
        "Trajectory Protection Schemes Based on a Gravity Mobility Model in IoT",
        "Performance Modeling of the IEEE 802.11p EDCA Mechanism for VANET",
        "Performance Modeling of IEEE 802.11 DCF Based Fair Channel Access for Vehicular-to-Roadside Communication in a Non-Saturated State",
        "A Taxonomy and Survey of Edge Cloud Computing for Intelligent Transportation Systems and Connected Vehicles",
        "Towards V2I Age-aware Fairness Access: A DQN Based Intelligent Vehicular Node Training and Test Method",
        "A Swarming Approach to Optimize the One-Hop Delay in Smart Driving Inter-Platoon Communications",
        "Performance Modeling and Analysis of the ADHOC MAC Protocol for Vehicular Networks",
        "Performance Modeling and Analysis of IEEE 802.11 DCF Based Fair Channel Access for Vehicle-to-Roadside Communication in a Non-Saturated State",
        "Vehicular Edge Computing and Networking: A Survey",
        "URLLC-Awared Resource Allocation for Heterogeneous Vehicular Edge Computing",
        "Mobility-Aware Cooperative Caching in Vehicular Edge Computing Based on Asynchronous Federated and Deep Reinforcement Learning",
        "High Stable and Accurate Vehicle Selection Scheme based on Federated Edge Learning in Vehicular Networks",
        "A Power Allocation Scheme for MIMO-NOMA and D2D Vehicular Edge Computing Based on Decentralized DRL",
        "Performance Analysis of IEEE 802.11p for Continuous Backoff Freezing in IoV",
        "Convergence Analysis and System Design for Federated Learning Over Wireless Networks",
        "Cooperative Edge Caching Based on Elastic Federated and Multi-Agent Deep Reinforcement Learning in Next-Generation Networks",
        "Artificial Intelligence Empowered Edge Computing and Caching for Internet of Vehicles",
        "Interference Alignment with Adaptive Power Allocation in Full-Duplex-Enabled Small Cell Networks",
        "Velocity-Adaptive V2I Fair Access Scheme Based on IEEE 802.11 DCF for Platooning Vehicles",
        "Delay-sensitive Task Offloading in Vehicular Fog Computing-Assisted Platoons",
        "Performance Modeling and Analysis of the ADHOC MAC Protocol for VANETs",
        "Optimal Deployment of Wireless Mesh Sensor Networks based on Delaunay Triangulations",
        "Investigation of the time-offset-based QoS support with optical burst switching in WDM networks",
        "LTE-V for sidelink 5G V2X vehicular communications: A new 5G technology for short-range vehicle to-everything communications",
        "Evolved Universal Terrestrial Radio Access (E-UTRA); Medium Access Control (MAC) Protocol Specification (v14.3.0, Release 14); Technical Report. 36.321",
        "Non-orthogonal multiple access for high-reliable and low-latency V2X communications in 5G systems",
        "Optimal Cooperative Beamforming Design for MIMO Decode-and-Forward Relay Channels",
        "Massive MIMO Beamforming With Transmit Diversity for High Mobility Wireless Communications",
        "SIC vs. JD: Uplink NOMA techniques for M2M random access",
        "Max-Min Energy Balance in Wireless-Powered Hierarchical Fog-Cloud Computing Networks",
        "Power Minimization in SWIPT Networks With Coexisting Power-Splitting and Time-Switching Users Under Nonlinear EH Model",
        "Achievable Information Rate in Hybrid VLC-RF Networks With Lighting Energy Harvesting",
        "The Feasibility of NOMA in C-V2X",
        "Performance Evaluation of NOMA for Sidelink Cellular-V2X Mode 4 in Driver Assistance System With Crash Warning",
        "Performance Improvement in Cellular V2X (C-V2X) by Using Massive MIMO Jacobi Detector",
        "Real-time status: How often should one update?",
        "AoI-minimal Power Adjustment in RF-EH-powered Industrial IoT Networks: A Soft Actor-Critic-Based Method",
        "Age of Information-Based Wireless Powered Communication Networks With Selfish Charging Nodes",
        "Age of Information Optimized MAC in V2X Sidelink via Piggyback-Based Collaboration",
        "Deep Deterministic Policy Gradient to Minimize the Age of Information in Cellular V2X Communications",
        "Discrete-Time Queueing Model of Age of Information With Multiple Information Sources",
        "Closed-Form AoI Analysis for Dual-Queue Short-Block Transmission with Block Error",
        "A Markov Perspective on C-V2X Mode 4",
        "Analytical Models of the Performance of C-V2X Mode 4 Vehicular Communications",
        "A Discrete-Time Markov Chain Based Comparison of the MAC Layer Performance of C-V2X Mode 4 and IEEE 802.11p"
    ],
    "reasoning": "Selected these 46 references because they represent foundational work and recent advances in Age of Information Analysis for Multi-Priority Queue and NOMA Enabled C-V2X in IoV This work was supported in part by the National Natural Science Foundation of China under Grant No. 61701197, in part by the National Key Research and Development Program of China under Grant No.2021YFA1000500(4), in part by the 111 Project under Grant No. B12018., providing essential background knowledge and methodological foundations relevant to this research."
}
